David offered to God a tribute of gratitude for the divine teaching and guidance he had received. "O God, thou hast 
                                                                           228
taught me from my youth" (Psalm 71:17), he declared. Those who in the history of the message have borne the burden and heat of the day, are to remember that the same Lord who taught them from their youth, inviting them, "Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me" (Matthew 11:29), and giving them the light of truth, is just as willing to teach young men and women today as He was to teach them.
